lexUnit.name: snap.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to break suddenly after the application of tension.

sentence.text: Springing from behind fat fluted columns , they seized two skaters and snapped their necks .
He could have snapped her neck with one hand , he thought pityingly .
Lastly there is some evidence for a diamond , quartz or garnet-tipped point being used to cut a groove along which the garnet could be snapped into two .
Pencils are snapped in two so there are more to go round .
Hamilton picked up a pencil , and deliberately snapped it in two .
` He broke a man 's arm a year ago , snapped it like a dried twig behind his back .
So they tied him with chains but the demonic powers were so great in his life that he snapped them like new cords .
People must believe that you 're such a tough shit you would snap them in half if they sneezed .
Benin turned back to Vasili then gripped the cassette in both hands and snapped it in half , allowing the tape to spill out on to the road .
Then , with a T-square positioned under the score mark , apply firm pressure to snap the glass .
Julian II snarled and stabbed the arm of his chair with a pencil , snapping it .
In his irrational anger he wanted to snap the lotus-stemmed wrist , and he tightened his grip until she winced .
Brahmadaitya are kind to humans , though should one be foolish enough to chop down the palm tree where this spirit lives , the offender 's neck will be snapped , like a twig .
If you do snap a twig then freeze and wait for several minutes before continuing .
